item.description:
Dave Rafkind will lead a discussion of Wicket at the November JAVA meetup.


Dave says:

'Wicket is a Java Web framework that provides a very clean encapsulation of state, making web programming seem "fun again". Wicket makes fancy AJAX effects extremely easy to integrate into an application, while keeping the browser-facing markup as simple as possible. Wicket's MVC style feels a lot like Swing and enables fairly rapid application development.'

Dave Rafkind writes web applications with Wicket at Traverse Technologies, a small government contractor. He recently moved to Cambridge after living in DC for several years.


Presentations/discussions are held at MIT's EHS Office, 265 Massachusetts Ave, upstairs from the MIT Museum; the office is on the 4th floor of the building; please use the door that is noted in the following picture:

presentation location

After the presentation we will head over to The Asgard, a restaurant/bar at the corner of Mass Ave and Sidney Street (350 Mass Ave):

asgard location

In the past, some of you may have parked your car in the lot adjacent to my building, but unfortunately the lot has since become a 24-hour tow zone for non-MIT vehicles. There is usually parking on Windsor street alongside my building.

Our meetings are personal, engaging and everybody is sharing in the topic at hand. Come and share your experience with your peers.

P.S.: Thank you to the many members that RSVP (one way or another). This helps your humble organizer to manage the crowd at the venue.

I hope to see you there.

Sincerely,


-John
item.how_to_find_us: 265 Massachusetts Avenue, Cambridge, across from Sunoco gas station
item.name: The Boston Java November Meetup: Wicket
